page.title: 17Hooley Comm. Ctr. & Church.
page.content: The community centre in Hooley exists for many widely differing functions. It consists of a main hall, library and cloakrooms. The hall is used for entertainments eg bingo, discos, dancing & whist drives. It also houses regularly meeting groups such as the W.I., Mother 'n Toddler and Youth Club. Residents of all ages can benefit from it. The library, situated to the left of the foyer, contains mainly novels. It also serves as a doctor's surgery. Hooley church stands at the top of a hill about 160 metres above sea level. The regular church services are well attended, approximately fifty people on average attending each service. In spite of being described as quiet, it can be seen that Hooley has quite a lot of village organised activity.
